profileDetails.name: MANOJ RAI
profileDetails.description: A self-taught, Kathmandu based UI/UX designer that enjoys making challenging situations fun. I’m aiming to be the most brilliant designer of my time.
profileDetails.hobby: When I am not using Figma, catch me sketching , reading , exploring modern trends, gaming, clicking random pics, and hanging with my favorite people ❤️.

quotesDetails.quotes: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.

personalities.title: I am INTP-T
personalities.description: Characterized by a strong analytical mind, a creative approach to problem-solving, and a continuous drive for self-improvement.

products.title: bettercollected
products.description: A privacy-focused form builder designed for conscious companies that prioritize the rights and data privacy of their form responders.
products.role: UI Designer, Researcher, Logo designer, UX Designer

products.title: Tootle
products.description: A ride-sharing platform based in Nepal. It allows users to book rides through a mobile app, connecting them with nearby riders who can provide transportation services.

products.title: Kuber IDE
products.description: PreSetup Environment for writing and trying out plutus contracts and cardano transactions.
products.role: UI Designer, Researcher, Logo designer, UX Designer

testimonials.thought: Manoj is a disciplined guy who delivered the assigned tasks within the deadline with a fantastic result. I highly recommend Manoj as a UI/UX Designer and would love to work together again.
testimonials.name: NIBESH KIRAN ADHIKARI

testimonials.thought: Manoj's design talent shines in diverse projects, making them user-friendly and innovative. Working with him is a joy; he's friendly and impactful in our digital endeavors.
testimonials.name: Niraj Duwal

testimonials.thought: Manoj's design prowess extends across various projects. His innovative approach and commitment to user-centric design have significantly elevated our products, leaving a lasting positive impact on our digital landscape.
testimonials.name: Rupan Chaulagain

facts: Designers spend hours debating between two nearly identical shades of gray, only to end up using both.
Male penguins often propose to their mates by offering them a pebble. Talk about a rock-solid commitment!
The Leaning Tower of Pisa was never intended to lean, but now it's one of the most famous leaning structures in the world.
Scientists discovered a fossilized dinosaur egg with an embryo inside, confirming that eggs came before chickens!
Butterflies use their feet to taste food. Imagine tasting your dinner by stepping on it!
Studies have shown that while women tend to read more fiction, men are more likely to read non-fiction.
Reading aloud can improve comprehension and memory retention. It's not just for children; adults can benefit from it too!
Vincent van Gogh's masterpiece "Starry Night" was painted while he was in a mental asylum. Maybe he was inspired by the nightly view from his window or the cosmic mysteries of the universe!
Vincent van Gogh only sold one painting during his lifetime? Despite his lack of commercial success, his paintings are now some of the most valuable and sought-after works of art in the world.
The term "Lorem Ipsum" used in graphic design is scrambled Latin from a work by Cicero? It's been the standard placeholder text since the 16th century.
Despite their name, banana trees are technically giant herbs, not trees. They're the world's largest herbaceous flowering plants.
